After having Dr. Martin at SRVS highly recommend to us the x-rays were sent over and we was told to be expecting a call from SRVS. It didn't take long before I was contacted by SRVS to set up an appointment for Pee Wee to come in and have surgery. The lady I spoke with on the phone was extremely nice and set up Pee Wee an appointment for the following day. The morning we arrived for surgery we was greeted by both ladies at the front desk and was checked in. We didn't have to wait no time before we was called to the back.
Dr. Martin discussed everything with us and we was given an estimate of what it would cost. When given the estimate it was detailed very well with the lowest and highest estimate. (Which I totally appreciated) When we checked out I was ASKED if I could pay the lowest estimate right then and told if it did go over that amount they would let me know the following day when I returned to take Pee Wee home. It was explained to me that if it ended up costing less than the lowest estimate that I paid the day of the surgery that they would refund me the difference. I appreciated the fact that I was given the lowest and the highest estimates that way I would know  about what the cost would be. A couple of hours later I received a call from Dr. Martin himself informing me off Pee Wee's condition and details of how the surgery went. I was told if I wanted he could come home the following day or he could stay an additional night if I felt more comfortable with him there. I chose to go ahead and bring him home the following morning because he was doing well and we missed him dearly. The day after surgery I returned to pick him up and Dr. Martin went over all the aftercare instructions with me and the medications given. Pee Wee is home resting now and is expected to make a full recovery! ♥ Thank you Dr. Martin and ALL the staff at SRVS for taking such wonderful care of Pee Wee,  you've been such a blessing to our family!!! May God continue to shower you with blessings, for you all are true blessings to us and our beloved pets! ♥ Thank you!

resp.text: This is a very personal account of your visit and it shows the process well.  I am thankful for your experience and that we were here to help you.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

name: Lisa Colvin
text: I was not aware of these emergency services. I am so thankful that they offer these service. Our fur baby became lethargic after 10 p.m. We went to SRVS and they were wonderful. He had to stay over night .  Everyone from the front desk staff, to the vet assistants, to the dr and to everyone who answered during the night and early morning when I called to check on him, were sweet, and comforting. They seemed to truly care about our puppy.  Words can not express how comforting it is to know now that if anything else happens to our fur baby that we can go to this amazing place. I highly recommend SRVS to take care of your pet.

resp.text: We are trying to make ourselves more visible to people so that others may benefit also.  I’m so glad that we were here for you in your time of need.

name: Laura Fowler
text: We used the emergency services when my husband and I woke up on a Sunday morning to our Lab vomiting and then suddenly began having uncontrolled bouts of bloody diarrhea. Our vet's after-hours services transferred us to Southern Regional, where the tech who answered the phone told us of the prices and that he needed to be brought in. We had Dr. Sayre who was very friendly and diagnosed him immediately with Hemmoragic Colitis and began treatment. Our baby was well enough to come home the next day and is doing fine. We have never had a dog that required overnight care, and given his symptoms, we were terrified that we could lose him. I am very happy with the care that he received, and while the visit was pricey, it was very much worth the immediate treatment.

name: Holly Ingram Speigner
text:
Very rude staff. My husband took his mother's dog in after she was attacked. Unfortunately Trixie didn't make it. We never received a bill in the mail but over a year later received a collections notice. We called to try and get some information as to why we never received a bill before we were sent to collections or why he was on a bill of his mother's and were ignored. They were extremely uncooperative and refused to even give information about the bill or how to take care of it.
GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

name: Sara Krystyn
text: Our pup just had her second surgery at SRVS yesterday (1/2/2019). She has had TTA's on both knees. Dr. Martin and his office staff have been absolutely incredible. From the moment you check-in you can tell they really care about you and your furry friend. They call when they say they will and they give you updates frequently. You hope your dog never has to have surgery, but if he or she does then it is such a blessing to have Dr. Martin and his staff in this area. Thank you to SRVS for caring for Nova (and us) so well. We appreciate all that you do!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind remarks and we were so thankful that you trusted us to care for your pup.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

name: Brittany Caver
text: Wonderful staff!! We are from out of town, visiting family for the holidays, and did not know what to do! The emergency vet took great care of our dog, who was diagnosed with pneumonia!

name: gmomey ninja cool The goat
text: I went to Southern Regional veterinary emergency services because my dog was foaming at the mouth and I didn't know what happened to her. Two other animals came in one came in after me that was poisoned and I understand the vet's office wanting to help take care of the dying animals but they completely disregarded my animal as well as keeping me in my 5 year old son waiting for over 1 hour do not go to this emergency care service they have horrible customer service and one of the vet her name is sue is totally rude

name: Tina Hart
text: They were fast, extremely nice, personal and there when you need them late at night. They could have charged me much more but they were kind enough not to. Definitely recommend if you're ever in an emergency situation.

name: johnathon cobb
text: We took our frenchie Ruby in for paralysis from hemivertebrae. They made us an appointment very quickly knowing how important it was. Sadly they were not able to help her due to it being a neurological issue. Dr. Martin was fantastic and his staff was great to deal with. They tried to help in any way they could. Very on the spot service. I will use them again and recommend them.

resp.text: It was a pleasure to serve your family and Ruby.  We are sorry that her symptoms could not be fixed with surgery.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you in the future.

name: Didi Oates
text: I will NEVER take another animal to this place again. My cat is now worse than when he went in with blockage in his bladder they charged me over $700 and still wanted more money.. well sorry to say but I can't afford to pay any more.. will be taking them to court!

resp.text: It is understandable that finances can be a limiting factor when dealing with a very sick animal.  This is why we presented you with an estimate and had you sign it.  We feel that knowing potential costs on the front end can help you make a better decision.  By signing the estimate, you authorized us to care for your cat and we stayed within the estimate provided.  You were informed of your cat's critical state and the need for surgical intervention.  You chose to discontinue treatment and you were angry with us for treating his fever.  Your cat was well cared for while here and surgery was the best option to improve his condition.  We are sorry that you elected not to pursue this option and continue treatment.

name: Anastasia Baker
text:
SRVS saved our Great Dane's life and we will forever be grateful!

On a Saturday night, Finnley started to panic and attempt to throw up. After 10-15 minutes, we knew something was terribly wrong. We were referred to SRVS from another emergency vet closer to home at Fort rucker via telephone because he strongly felt  she had  major surgical problem. He advised us that they were the only ones set up for surgery unless we drove her to Auburn, AL. Regardless of them being the closest, we wouldn't have chosen anyone else knowing the experience we've had.

The staff immediately took an x-ray and Dr. Champion confirmed our worst fear, she had a flipped stomach. Finnley would have been dead in a matter of hours had they not rushed her in for a Gastric Dilation Volvulus (GDV) surgery right then. Yes, it was expensive. However, they are a specialized staff that are available at all hours of the night to care for your animals. We love our Finnley like she is no less important than any other member of our family. No doubt about it, she would have died. No matter the cost, we would have paid it. However, they were extremely fair. We paid the $3k right then but received nearly $800 back as a refund when we picked her up a couple days later. They didn't have to do that! We would have been none the wiser that they didn't need the entire amount and I believe it shows what great and honest people they are. I felt especially compelled to write this review because from what I've read, nearly all of the "negative" reviews are price related.

The staff kept us in the loop every step of the way and even allowed us to come sit with her the following day and walk her around a little bit. We were even able to drop off a couple of our tshirts, treats and a bag of her food to see if that would spur an appetite. I have nothing but gratitude for this staff and facility! Our Finnley is happy, healthy and back to our family all thanks to them.

resp.text: You have no idea how grateful we are that Finnley is doing well now.  We also received your kind note too and it was also appreciated.  Emergency medicine is difficult and clients like you make it worth it.  Thank you for taking the time to share your story with us.  We were glad to meet you but sorry for the circumstances surrounding our meeting.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do to assist you in the future.

name: Sally M
text: Spent $4000 on back surgery on our 4 year old dachshund.  Brought  her home two days after surgery. Died two days later. Never told why. Dog was completely paralysis (front & back legs). Wish we had never had the surgery. Her back legs would have been paralzed, but she would still be alive.

resp.text: I am having a difficult time determining who you are to be sure I address your concerns appropriately.  In general, the surgeon discusses and goes over prognosis before proceeding with surgery.  Dachshunds are prone to have herniated discs and sometimes the herniation itself can damage the cord beyond what can be corrected surgically.  It sounds like this could have been the case with your pet.  If you are willing, I would invite you to contact our office so that we can talk to you about what happened and provide you with the answers you are seeking.  I am very sorry for your loss and would like to help if we can.

name: Joe Lashley
text:
I firmly believe that Dr. Martin is responsible for the death of my little boy Duke, through greed and/or negligence.  I believe he was more concerned about how many surgeries he could do that day and how much money he could make.  Duke is a Miniature Dachshund.  They are prone to have back problems.  When he was 11 years old he woke me up about midnight in pain.  I took him to SRVS where they gave him a shot.  I spent about $200 then.  The next morning, he was still in pain so I took him back.  They gave him narcotics and put him on an IV of fluids.  He did not have access to water, otherwise. I believe they gave him too much narcotics because he was howling and did not even recognize me when I went to see him.   After a quick diagnosis, they said he needed surgery on his back near his neck.  They couldn’t do surgery right away because he was dehydrated.  Dr. Martin admitted they did not give him sufficient fluids. They told me they would have to do a Myelogram.  I specifically asked Dr. Martin “What are the dangers?”  He remarked that he may hit a bone (vertebrae) and have to move the needle.  He did not say anything else or tell me of any complications.  When I confronted Dr. Martin about his answer regarding complications, his remark was “My bad”, meaning himself that he didn’t inform me.  That was no consolation. Duke also had seizures that I was never told could occur.  When I got upset about that, his daughter got all high and mighty like I had done something wrong.  It was only later in talking with friends that I realized how dangerous this procedure was.  In my opinion they did not take necessary precautions when administering the Myelogram, such as keeping his head elevated so that it didn’t go to his brain.  The next day they took him outside to potty but said he just wanted to sit down.  This was the second lie I was told.  In actuality, his hind legs were paralyzed from the Myelogram.  Then his liver and kidneys started failing.  They put him on an IV to try to regain function but it was too late.  On the discharge papers they told their third lie.  They said that he was standing on his own.  At that point I took him to his regular Vet where they tried desperately to save his life.  The damage had already been done.  I took him home.  I took him outside and he took two wobbly steps and that was the last time he walked.   Duke lost his dignity and his pride when he lost control of his bowels and bladder.  I had to have him put to sleep the next day because of what I believe was negligence by Dr. Martin.  That just about killed me.  I knew my little boy had a few good years left.  He never reimbursed me for the surgery he never performed which to me shows just how greedy he is.  I took him to small claims court just to show him that there are consequences.  He didn’t need a lawyer because the judge argued his case because he was a “Professional”.  Professional or not, he lied in my opinion. I spent about $5000 at SRVS.  Of that about $3000 was for surgery.  Dr. Martin never reimbursed me a single penny for surgery that was NOT performed.  I still mourn the loss of Duke.  My only solace is that he is in Heaven.
Everything I’ve expressed here is my opinion but I believe everything to be truthful.

name: CANDICE LANCASTER
text: I have read all the negative reviews and felt compelled to give my experience which was quite different. I do admit when I first called this clinic the receptionist answering the phone was extremely unpleasant but do to the fact that this is the only clinic for emergency, my husband and I didn't let that deter us. Dr. Loral Sayre..the vet on duty was wonderful and seemed to really care...she sent us home to watch my Dachshund who unfortunately digressed thru the night and needed surgery next day. Dr. Martin did the surgery and was overwhelmingly compassionate and understanding...even MORE important he did an excellent surgery with outstanding results...we are 2 days post op and my dog is recovering remarkably. The staff was very welcoming and I must say I would not hesitate..GOD forbid...if I have another medical emergency to return to this clinic.

name: Rick Bendinger
text: Very good experience they were able to take care of my pets emergency issues in a very professional and timely manner completely satisfied

resp.text: Thank you Rick for the kind words.  We hope that Augie continues to do well but please let us know if we can be of future assistance.

name: Danielle Barton
text: I took my Standard Poodle in for vomiting on 1/15/17.  The receptionist behind the counter Marsha was overwhelmed because there were numerous emergencies going on that night, but deposite the overwhelmingness she remained extremely friendly and helpful.  The female veterinary that we was was amazing and extremely helpful with treating my baby.  A lot of people complain about the price,  but to me it was well worth it to help me baby.  Remember this when complaining about prices... this staff could be at home with their families and loved ones,  but instead they are saving animals nightly without complaint.  It makes me feel better as a pet owner that there is a place like this!

name: Greg Howard
text:
If you're in the Wiregrass area of Alabama and need an emergency veterinarian, I highly recommend Southeast Regional Veterinary Services on Westgate Parkway in Dothan.

Last weekend our three-year-old laborador retriever was bitten by a snake. We didn't see it happen, but we noticed his leg swelling up very badly by about 1:00 p.m. Sunday afternoon.

They got Chip in fast, did bloodwork to check how far the venom had progressed and affected him, and gave him prescription meds and sent a report to our regular vet. All within one hour.

And they really knew how to deal with a scared and injured dog.

They were great and worth every penny.

resp.text: Snake bites can be fatal and we are so glad Chip did well.  Thank you for trusting us with his care and know that we are here if you need us again in the future.

name: Joe F. Watson
text: They demand/require cash up front or they will let your pet die. No negotiation. The veterinarians in our area have done us a disservice by supporting this place.

resp.text: Mr. Watson, thank you for expressing your concern.  I cannot confirm that you visited our hospital.  If you would like to call and discuss this matter, I would be happy to do so.  We can be reached at 334-699-7787.

name: Sue Rendon
text: The prices are criminal. $2000 to remove a few bladder stones on a Saturday?  Two years ago Dr Stembridge did it all for $350. My baby will suffer until Monday. Where's the compassion?  It's all about the money.

name: ralph mcdaniel
text:
The bloodwork ordered on my initial visit, did not get processed. I was billed however. then asked to bring my dog back in to have more blood drawn, then told no the blood had been sent off then told no it really did need to be drawn again. They were clueless.And hesitant to refund the charge for the bloodwork until I spoke with the manager over a week after my initial visit.
This is a poorly run place that seems to do a good job of caring for the animals. While overpriced, they are nice vets. Use at your own risk.

name: miriam sexton
text: I knew since Thursday, the 2nd of July, that I was fixing to lose my 19 year old Himalayan female baby.  She had stopped eating and was barely able to drink anything.  I was selfish and tried to hold onto her as long as I could.  But Sunday, I could not handle it anymore, she started seizing and I had to take her in to be put to sleep.  She was the last of 3 kitties that lived to be 20 and 17 years old.  The people and doctor were great in my time of loss.  Thanks to everyone who works there to help with my baby to cross over the rainbow to be reborn again with God.

name: R Craig
text:
After reading the reviews about this hospital I was compelled to counter. Sounds to me like most of the folks were in seek of free advice. If you need after hours emergency care, you can certainly expect to pay for it. The first time I called this clinic was late at night on a weekend and I agree, the person I spoke with was definitely determined to get my commitment to pay if a Vet was coming to meet me. How many of you would get up at 3:00 AM on a Sunday morning and go to your office if you were not going to get paid? I can only imagine the frustration they experience when pet owner has a possible emergency but yet balks when expected to pay to have their pet treated. It is very expensive to obtain the education necessary to cure animals of diseases and to fix them surgically. Should they do it for free? Is it wrong to make money? There's a difference between a business and a charity. Some evidently don't realize that.

I was thrilled with the care my dog received. Yes it was expensive!! So what, they saved my dogs life...Dr. Martin removed an insulinoma- a tumor from his pancreas and inspected his lymph nodes, liver, etc. for signs of spreading.
A major surgery that included over 48 hours in the hospital. should I complain about the bill? Should it have been cheap? If your child had cancer would you look for the cheapest oncologist? Of course not. The doctors at STVS are kind, patient, and most importantly skilled. If I went to College for a decade and spent God knows how much money on those degrees, I would like to think I would be well compensated for my expertise. Try calling a surgeon at your local people hospital and asking them if you should come into the hospital or not? Come on folks....everything related to medical care, animals or people, is expensive. If you had gone in and paid the 250,  you would have received very good care for your animal!!! Thank you to Dr. Martin and the entire staff! You guys were awesome from the moment we walked in the door. :)

name: Phyllis Dickens
text: They took really great care of my dog.

resp.text: Thank you for posting!  We are glad to be here for you.

name: Matthew Spence
text: I only put one star cause I couldn't put 0. We took our pet rabbit Phil in Saturday cause he had a back injury. I understand he's a rabbit and most people or vets don't consider them as important as a dog but he was important to us. I got there and was made to wait almost an hour with him partially paralyzed and seizing. Then I paid the $112 fee to be seen up front and waited some more. The vet came to the front a few times and never spoke to me other than awe that's sad. I didn't know she was the vet till I was finally seen. Then she looked at Phil for about 60 seconds and said his back is broken, I could take your money and do an x-Ray but I recommend putting him down. We discussed the options then I said let's put him out of his pain. I was then made to go pay more money ($16) to have his suffering ended. Then I waited awhile while they tortured him and blew out the veins in his front legs trying to euthanize him. That didn't work so they took him to the back and I got to hear him scream as they jammed a needle into his heart to put him down. Then they put him in a box handed him over and said we're sorry have a nice day.  Don't take your pets to these people.

name: Allen Bell
text:
Dr. Martin was awesome. Our anatolian shepherd had OCD surgery and all went well.

We had an 8 week check up post surgery for Xrays and received another bill. Nothing cheap either 157.00 to ensure the healing was correct. This was very unexpected especially after what the initial Xrays and surgery cost. I have never had a follow-up after surgey that I paid for on myself, so maybe they are chasing the money.

Again nothing but kind words can be said about Dr Martin.

2 out of 5 stars because the fee for the post op was not discussed.

name: Delane Deshazo
text: I call the vets office when my dog attacked my bird and was told by management told me no one could see my bird today i called every other vets office in the area the only other vet that could have seen him was an hour and a half away . And he has died

resp.text: I apologize for your loss.  I am management and was not consulted about this.  While I am not sure what transpired, I find it unusual that our staff would make that comment.  Feel free to reach out to me in the morning and I will be happy to hear what happened.

name: sharon somnitz
text: Brought my dog in who was not eating or drinking,  and had a swollen ear. Was told the ear was a hematoma and that it was resolving it self. Was told he had abdominal pain and that they would run dianogstics, I left him for a few hours also spent over $700. I had to take him to my regular vet which had been faxed all the paperwork to run more tests... turns out my vet found fang marks on his ear.... instead of a possibility of infection and other guesses,  it was a snake bite. After my vet gave him the proper care  and less than a $100 he is up and running, and a good as new! Do not take your furry baby to these people unless it's a last resort.

name: Wurlitzer Y
text: not a good experience.  non existent compassion and care during an emergency.  just...how do you want to pay.

resp.text: Sir, I was in the middle of responding to your post and it has since changed.  I will address your previous comments.  Your pet passed away eight months ago.  We have tried reaching you during that time and your voicemail was not accepting voicemails.  To your own admission this evening, you blocked our number which would explain our difficulty reaching you.  We only release and give updates on remains by phone since we value compassion and know how difficult losing a pet can be.  We safely stored your pet's remains for eight months hoping that you would come back for them or call for an update.  Thank you for coming by this evening to retrieve your pet's remains.  Though you were disappointed with your experience, we are thankful we were here to help you in your time of need.

name: Virginia Scruggs
text: This review is not based on their service or does not reflect the doctors of this Veterinary Practice.  I have come across a very disturbing video on Vine that has this Veterinary Practice tagged as the place.  The video is of a technician playing with an amputated arm of an animal.  When others commented that they did not feel this post was appropriate, this person used extremely foul and derogatory language. As a veterinary technician myself, I feel like this is very disrespectful to the family of that animal who is now suffering without a limb.  And it is extremely unprofessional to post such derogatory language while you are representing your place of work.  It utterly shocks me that this type of behavior is tolerated.

name: Sandy Jean
text: My cuz was just there today and while (ment for human hospital) the black lady was given narcotics for bone pain,& a NOW former employee of my brother business was there yesterday FOR SAME THING, no broken bones,  was given narcotics, because a toren rotor cuff is extremely painful, my next move, Attorneys. We sued, & won last case, & i"ll sue again. Taking my cuz to real hospital, where they aren't rude to a pastors wife. P.S:u forget donations to domestic violence shelters, or homeless shelters!

resp.text:
Hi Sandy,

We are a veterinary practice and believe you may have meant this review for a completely different facility.

Respectfully,
Scott Burton

name: Graham Ernst
text: I was recommended by another veterinary near Fort Rucker to see SRVS due to the fact they couldn’t accommodate larger dogs on their x-ray table. Naturally, I didn’t had much of a choice b/c of my dog issue. The desk clerk seemed to be new at her job b/c she continued to ask surrounding vet specialist for help on every question that I asked. After basic paperwork, I was hit with an itemized bill that was x2 the cost for normal OFA x-rays and submission fees. I also had to write down my credit card information on the OFA paperwork for additional reading and filing fees (In which, I learned later this is false). Now, I fear about my credit card information. I questioned everything with little to no help. Faced with little choice at the time, I continued with the process. Before they took my dog, they asked me if I had any questions before they begin. I ask how are they going to evaluate my dog’s legs to determine if it’s a soft tissue or ACL damage. They replied by saying during sedation they would flex my dogs legs by feeling for full range of motion. I, again, ask how is that going to determine anything since my dogs muscle is relaxed and limped. That answer didn’t settled well with me. In the mist, the desk clerk wanted me to pay upfront for the entire procedure. I questioned this action since it was unusual. She replied that it is company policy and we would credit your card if any after the procedure. I told her that I wasn’t leaving my dog during his sedation (previously showed her my military card to validate personal information) and my dog is microchip with corresponding information. After the x-rays, the veterinary physician went over the x-rays. He didn’t give me any answers to why my dog was having issues with his rear legs. However, he kept on saying that German Shepherds are prone to hip dysplasia. This was his go to answer for everything. He didn’t provide recovery recommendations, treatment, potential future issues, or anything. I felt like I was rushed after they finished the x-rays. After paying that high bill, I asked if they had a dog gurney to ease my dog’s problem but nothing. The following day (today) I reviewed this situation with the on post vet. They were shocked and surprised by the entire process. Now, I am in the process to black list them from post. BE ADVISED IF YOU GO HERE.

name: Christa Berkowitz
text: Horrible ppl.  Rude uncaring disrespectful.  DO NOT COME HERE

name: Jane Lambert
text: Do not take you're pet there tues are horrible heartless cold people they let my 8 month baby die they could have saved her

name: Andrea White
text: Very friendly, helpful, & excellent care.

resp.text: Thank you for your review of our business.  It is good to hear that we are meeting our client's needs.  Please let us know if there is more we can do to assist you in the future.

name: Amy “Dorkyndaft” Nelson
text: Fabulous staff and very caring!

name: June Green
text: Very rude vet Techs during an emergency with your pet dying

name: Madison Carter
text: Paid bunches of money for me to get my dog back and he is still throwing up and not eating and won’t even take the medicine that the doc prescribed for him called them back to tell them and they were very very rude to me to say the least.

resp.text: I have looked and we do not have a Madison Reynolds in our system.  Did you use another name or are you sure you are contacting the correct practice?  Regardless, please call us so that we can understand and clear up any confusion.  334-699-7787

name: Lynda Anderson
text: Took my. American bulldog there was told her injuries were minor and needed to wait till the emergencies were done first was given a bill of 675.00 my bulldog suffered severely for 6 hours before she painfully passed away ,don't bring your dog here they didn't even apologize instead said I should've given them more money for testing they said she didn't need !!!   Very disturbing!!!

resp.text: I am sorry for your loss of your pet and would like to discuss this with you more over the phone if that is something you are willing to do.  We do triage cases based on severity and I do not know the specific cases that were there that night or the specifics of your pet's clinical presentation that would have caused the veterinarian to treat other cases before yours.  Scott is the Hospital Administrator and he would be the one to speak with to explore what happened.  Again I am sorry for the passing of your pet and wish you comfort during your time of grief.

name: Michael Skinner
text: Offers after hours vegetarian care

name: James Walker
text: Wonderful Vets and great staff!  We have always had a fun and pleasurable experience!

name: Pamela Martin
text: Love this place! They are an All animal hospital that come to my house to administer my dogs' vaccinations. Max loved the treatment and atmosphere of the hospital on Capshaw. He had an ear hematoma that they drained without any problems. Max is an older canine that I took to an Equine hospital in our home town, so he the atmosphere around the horses is perfect for him.

name: Tricia Engels
text: Drivers are irresponsible and erratic the old woman that answers is rude and unprofessional would highly recommend someone else

name: David Guido
text: Brought the boys in (2x 🐎) for their yearly exam and check up. Short wait but great service , very thorough visit and background exam.  The Vet spent time with us and answered all questions. Certainly gets our recommendation.

name: Ambur Love
text: I take my dog here, and I love the it! The workers are sweet and down to earth. The vet for the smaller animals explains everything very well, and I feel like I can trust him. I'm glad I found them as my new vet.

name: Mary Guthrie
text: Dr. Dunlap and his staff are outstanding. No matter whether it is a wellness visit at the clinic or he has to come to your place for a problem, you can count on him to provide excellent care for your horse and he is great with us humans too. Lucky to have him!

name: Jana Russell Nails
text: I love the folks here. Dr Harney and Dr Dunlap are knowledgeable and friendly; their assistants are helpful and personable too. Whether they're coming out to my ranch or seeing my animals at their facility I can always count on them to take care of my furry babies.  They see small animals too!

name: Gayle Barnett
text: Dr Dunlap has been my horse vet for about 8 years. He and his staff have provided routine and emergency services for us, and they are always professional, knowledgable and compassionate. I feel like my horses will get excellent veterinary care and they also take the time to be sure that I understand and am comfortable with the recommended treatments.

name: Ourania Murphy
text: Excellent practice

name: Donna Love
text: Great place and great people

name: Marie Lyons
text: Best vet ever

name: s d
text: I trust my pets at Duke Animal clinic.  I take my dog to get his teeth cleaned and Dr. Duke does a great job at that, and for everything else, the clinic is very accommodating for my schedule.  I even take my dog there for a bath and nail trim because they do a good job.

name: Sheli E
text:
My super-senior, Max, went in for a full mouth extraction due to stomatitis. Dr Duke was referring to me by two clinics and I’m extremely happy with the care my baby received.

A vet tech from the clinic I went to for a second opinion had told me the usual price was around 900, but to be aware it may cost more depending on any additional meds or services he may need. The office at Duke Animal Clinic quoted the same price. 900 was more than reasonable as I usually get vet care in Atlanta and prices are insane there.

Although his appointment was further out than I had hoped, when he finally had his surgery I was  pleased at the level of care he received and that Dr Duke gave me a copy of mouth photos (before and after) and explained what he did by showing me on the photos.

Max is healing up nicely, is back to being mischievous, AND the price was just under 900 even though I was prepared for more.

I 100% recommend Duke Animal Clinic to anyone needing dental care for their pets.

name: Ligma
text: Always bring my cats here. Duke animals clinic is the best IMO

name: Adam Campbell
text: My wife took her Chihuahua to Duke Animal Clinic to have a procedure done for his teeth. We were told by the clinic that the cost was going to be around $400, which we were fine with. After the procedure, the clinic charged us nearly $700 without any change in scope-of-service or explanation of the increase. This is beyond unethical business practice. The people that run Duke Animal Clinic are the dishonest crooks they have proven themselves to be. If they cannot be trusted at their word, how can someone trust them with their pets?

name: Cynthia Jones
text: The Doctors and Staff are top notch and honest with tx for your furbabies. They will never try to talk you into things that you may not be able to afford and will never make you feel guilty about it. They are so kind and compassionate. Loving environment.

name: Krizia Tokarski Jackson
text: Dr. Duke is amazing with my dogs, and very friendly. All the staff was helpful and kind. He took the time to answer all of our questions patiently and makes us feel like he really cares about animals. Not to mention prices are extremely reasonable, plus they do military discount.

name: samantha kirby
text: They are so awesome and caring.Dr. duke himself is one of the very best vets i have ever seen.he saved my baby belle and i will forever be thankful to him.

name: Olivia McCarter
text: I've used Dr. Mims ever since I moved to Alabama and got my first dog. He is a very compassionate and kind man and he was very good with Ella. When she had a tumor, he quickly diagnosed it and sent off a sample of it to confirm. We had to go through chemotherapy and it was coming to the point where my Lab was excited to go to vet. That's how great these people are. They knew Ella by name and were very gentle and kind to her. I'll continue to use Dr. Mims and Dr. Duke and recommend them to anyone with pets.

name: Tracy Johnson
text: I only like Dr. Duke. Everyone else puts fear in me like they suggest things that I dont agree my pets need. Ive had dogs all my life and they have always lived long healthy lives. Dr. Duke always said they are healthy when I would see him. He never suggested anything like the others all do.

name: Linda Hulsey
text: Everyone at Duke's have been great.  The prices are very reasonable and usually you are able to see a vet in a very short time.  This is first vets office that I have been totally comfortable with my babies being here.  I walked in to check the place unannounced and was given a tour.  Found the staff friendly and the place was very clean.  Since moving back to Mobile this is the first place that I am truly comfortable bring my 12 Dachshunds to.  Recommend Duke Animal Clinic to anyone with pets.

name: Leigh Merz
text: They always take great care of our fur babies!

name: Mike Rankin
text:
I have been using Duke since 2011.  I have always been pleased with the veterinarians at Duke, and until a year ago was please with the office staff.  But a year ago, I noticed a lot of turnover in the office.  Now, Duke's office is an administrative nightmare.

Until Duke is able to retain a front office staff long enough to attain seasoned, well functioning staff employees, I would avoid this clinic.

name: Joshua Carter
text: My 13yo English Springer Spaniel was very sick.   After spending a night in the Vet ER, I just showed up on a Saturday with no scheduled appointment very worried and had never seen him before.  Dr. Duke was nice enough to stay late and look at him.  Ollie is alive today thanks to him.  Great guy.  great place.  very affordable.  I highly recommend them!

name: Sherry McSween
text: I have used Duke animal clinic for 30 years with large and small animals. Dr. Duke has always gone above and beyond in taking care of our animals along with Dr. Justin Mims.. The Doctors have gone to extra lengths to treat my animals in the best way possible. Staff is good and always try to help in anyway they can. They also take after hours calls for established clients. Dr. Duke specializes in dentistry and has clients come from all over the Gulf Coast. I can't tell you how happy I am with this clinic.

name: T&D Professional Tree Removal
text: I went the first time and everyone made us feel welcome. They tended to my pet's needs and the price was very affordable. We Thank ALL of them there for their hospitality.

name: Larry Bowles
text: Duke Animal Clinic was recommended by a good friend. We were seen right away and made to feel welcome.Care and  cleanliness was excellant.  I will switch to this Vet for our other furry children(3 dogs and 2 Cats).

name: Carissa Pessia
text: Overall we love the care we receive at Duke Animal Clinic. Appointments are always available and the staff is very caring. We brought our rescue dog here after adopting her. They’ve always provided great care

name: Ruth Darlene Stewart
text: This is update to my review a few months ago.  October 23 2018.  Last evening I had an emergency with one of my older beagles.  Dr. Jane Snead was on call. I give her five stars!  She was compassionate, competent and very thorough in her treatment of my Kate. Unfortunately due to bleeding abdominal tumor the decision was made to PTS.  I have the most respect for veterinarians that take on call for their established clients.  Many vets are opting to send their clients to ER clinic and not take call at all. Thank you Dr. Snead for being available and the excellent care provided to Kate.   I have used Dr. Duke ( Duke Animal Clinic) for almost 40 years.  Dr. Mims and Dr. Duke as well as others have always been there when needed. His support staff are always outstanding and friendly.  I have received excellent care and encourage others to use Duke Animal Clinic

name: Murriah Barnette
text: I love Duke Animal Clinic! I volunteered/worked there a few years in middle and high school. Dr. Duke and his staff really care and treat your pets as if they were their own. I am glad to be back in Mobile!

name: Eric Sulivant
text: We've been to three different vets with our 2 yr old dog and this is easily the best. They are always looking out for what's best for our dog and never overcharge! Definitely recommend these guys!

name: Theresa Smith
text: Very Friendly and compassionate Staff, they make you feel very Welcome there.

name: Donna Buckley
text: Dr. Duke and Dr. Newcombe are the best vets I have ever known. I have used 4 other vets in my 69 years and they don't even compare to the Duke clinic. They are reasonable also.

name: Kaitlyn Kingery
text: I have been using Duke Animal Clinic for the past two years. I would not trust anyone else with my pets! Dr. Duke, Dr. Mims, Dr. Caddell and the rest of the staff are amazing :)

name: David Rich
text: I picked up a rescue horse today and to haul it back to Florida I had to have a cogens done and they did it while I waited ,great service

name: brittney buker
text: Duke animal clinic came out to my house to examine my horses, Dr.Mims was excellent with horses. I would recommend him to any one. The prices were also great!

name: M R
text: Unprofessional staff! We had a bad experience and cannot even share our review without the clinic falsly reporting it!  The staff reports any negative review, although legitimate, then uses friends and employees spouses/family to flood positive reviews. Just ask around town,  Duke animal clinics reputation speaks for itself and Dr Mims takes most of the accolades. If a business gets so worked up and has the time to troll Google daily, they may not be the best business to trust with your pets care.

name: Nathan Hewlett
text: Refused to listen to my opinion and consider my ideas once their ideas had proven to not be working.

name: J Slay
text: We've always taken our dogs to duke animal clinic and never had problems, however that all came crashing down yesterday on 7/15/16 our 2 year old dachshund maverick was shot in the neck through our privacy fence by a pellet gun. At the time we didn't know it was a gun shot, we figured it he caught a nail in the neck while playing with his brother under our shed. When my wife showed up at 1:20 the receptionist was as rude as anyone could be to my already frantic wife. She told her no vets were in because they were on lunch. Then when my wife said so there's not a single thing you can do (keep in mind my dog is right in front of her bleeding all over the place) she rolled her eyes and said she could kennel him until they got back from lunch unless it was a real emergency...really lady??my dog is bleeding from his neck everywhere, but no it's not an emergency. After my took him down the road to Irby Overton where they immediately took him back and extracted the bullet from his neck. They said if it would've been a centimeter lower it would've hit his artery in his neck and he would've bled to death in a matter of minutes. Needless to say we are switching to Irby Overton permanently.

name: C Lynn
text: When you pay $60 for a meaningless consult, you should be allowed to share your experience. However, this business seems to have a lot of time on their hands to continuously attempt to dispute a legitimate review. Dr. Duke was condescending and his experience seems to be as out of date as the clinic itself is. I will not use this clinic ever, and would not trust anyone in this clinic with my pets.

name: Charla Ruby
text: Dr duke is an insensitive crule jurk. He did not sedate my baby enough,then used too big of a needle and kept shoving it in and out so much that she was in pain scared crying out till she finally left this word. Never ever is this the way it is supposed to be. 😩😓😡

name: Jerry Adams
text: This place is awesome the vet Dr. Took extra time to fix my cats problem where the other place I took her took didn’t  if your reading this and need a awesome  place to bring your pet this is the place

name: cindie Carter
text: Walks and Wags loves Duke Animal Clinic!

name: Cyndi Johnson
text: My dog received the best treatment. All my questions were answered and I felt as though the new vet did a wonderful job! I would see her again! I have never had a bad experience. I highly recommend them to everyone!

name: Mayle Pujol
text: We are new in town....Finding a great veterinarian was important! We had a great experience From the moment we were greeted at front desk to the moment we checked out. I was very concerned about my dog getting sick bc he’s usually healthy. Dr. Brumsky took her time checking Forrest and making sure he got the right meds and dosage. He’s doing better and we are thankful to her and staff.

name: Becky Pounders
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital is outstanding. The love and care they show for the animals they treat is amazing. They care about each one as if it was their own. They have been great with helping our Willow and I wouldn't even imagine taking her anywhere else. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a place for your fur babies. You will not be disappointed.

name: Sidney Magoon
text: I took my dog, Jethro, there and they were great! The vet was very helpful! He sat on the floor with my dog and was interacting with him to gain his trust so he could look at his ears. I thought that was just awesome! I was also in and out in a timely manner.

name: Christy Shaw
text: We Love NAAH!! They are wonderful, the whole staff!! Our Max Loves going to the vet, his tail starts wagging when we get there, they are really great with all animals!

name: Susan Cole
text: The staff are always so kind and very knowledgeable. Most important, they care about my fur baby.  I lost a kitty last year, and they were so kind and comforting to me during my loss.  In the end, they went above and beyond to help her and without a doubt, she received the best care possible.  I'm thankful for all the staff and will always remember their kindness and dedication to the work they do.  You will feel the same after your first visit.

name: Brenda Lee
text: I got a little crazy when I went to Birmingham and Rocky got worse than he had been and posted a negative remark. It has been taken down. I came home and saw Dr Thompson and we discussed Rocky and options. At one point Rocky could not go outside without coughing. I have been following the plan that was worked out with Dr Thompson and Rocky went out today. He was not coughing and before I could catch him he was across the road checking out girls. Thank you Dr Thompson for giving my dog back his quality of life. We have been out several times and no coughing. We are following the plan.

name: Terri Sassone
text: We are new to the area and changing vets is stressful. Benny's visit was great. He's a special needs senior boy and the vet and staff were awesome. Benny had them trained to give him treats in no time! We will be bringing our other two hooligans in soon!

name: Heath King
text: We started using NAAH after moving to the Shoals area, and our experiences so far have been excellent. We had to make the difficult decision this week to put our dog down after his fight with cancer. We were so pleased with how compassionate, patient, helpful and caring the staff at NAAH were. I would highly recommend North Alabama Animal Hospital to anyone!

name: Lee Renfroe
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital is a very kind, caring practice with high quality veterinarians and staff.  I hold them in very high regard and trust them completely with my pets!  Awesome organization!

name: Janice Smith
text: I trust that everyone at North Alabama Animal Hospital will take excellent care of my pets. They are always competent and compassionate. It is obvious that they love what they do!

name: Laura Hamner
text: North Alabama Animal Hospital does an amazing job caring for our chocolate lab. I would, and do, highly recommend NAAH to anyone who is looking for a team to care for their beloved pet(s). Keep up the good work NAAH.

name: Catie Gajewski
text: The staff was very friendly and the doctor was very thorough getting my leg updated on vaccinations.

name: Vince Brewton
text: Troy and his staff provide great care and treatment. North Alabama Animal Hospital is one of two vet practices in the area we recommend to friends and newcomers. Troy's expertise and experience are outstanding.

name: Emily Parker
text: They have taken care of many of my fur babies over the years. They not only provide great care of the animal but the owner as well. I’ll never forget the horrible day I had to put my Sweetie girl down but I will also never forget the compassion of Dr Youngblood and the techs that day. I highly recommend this office and all the docs!

name: Camilla MIller
text: Everyone was fantastic. So nice and helpful. Thank you for the love you all have for animals. Don't believe you could have made the experience any better!

name: Sandra Johnson
text:
Wonderful  Drs. and staff, they are very patient and caring toward both patients and owners. They really do strive to give the very best care that you could possibly want for your pets at extremely reasonable prices. In my opinion
They are the best in the business. You will never regret taking your babies (pets) to
them.

name: Alison Hawn
text: We are forever grateful to NAAH for all they do to take care of our two babies Max & Okie! They are both high maintenance pups and require a great deal of medical attention. We are always beyond satisfied with the care they receive and the courteous way we are always treated. We truly appreciate everything they do for our babies!

name: tuscaniracer27
text: You guys are always amazing. Your customer service and pet care are top notch. Thank you so much for providing such a great place!

name: Sara Shapiro
text: Dr. Bonner at North Alabama Animal Hospital has provided the best of care for our three dogs. He is professional and is always responsive to their needs.

name: Christy Arnold
text:
What a great team at NAAH!
You all are awesome!
Daisy is happy

name: David Painter
text: I've taken my dogs here for years. I've seen all the doctor's at some point and time. I usually see Adam Thompson; he's very nice and listens to your concerns. I highly recommend all of the doctor's.

name: Cassidy Beck
text: I've been to plenty of vets in the Shoals and I was recommended to come here by a family member and this will be the only vet clinic I use from now on. my cat had a small procedure done & the vet called me personally to tell me that everything went well and took the time to explain what all they did and asked if I had any questions (Ive never had a vet do this before) The receptionists and the other ladies were super nice, too. A great experience.

name: Laura Engdahl
text: I like being able to go in the clinic with my pets. Under the current circumstances- COVID19- I understand why I could not. I think that the curbside process worked quite well. NAAH is a great place to take your pets. Very caring. I’ve been using them over five years. They always get you in when you need to get in. 😻😻😻

name: Rebecca Patterson
text: Excellent care for our senior schnauzer “Sophie”. Not only the normal checkups but an extensive surgery made us feel like they truly care as much as I do.

name: Lisa Morgan
text: Very clean facility. Staff is very professional and pleasant. Atmosphere is very pleasant. My pup loves the staff. They treat him like there own. Would highly recommend my friends and family to this facility.

name: Darcy Williams
text: Dr. Thompson and the rest of the staff always go above and beyond to take care of my kitties and always keep me well informed. I appreciate them so much!

name: John Fisher
text: We brought our dog here at the recommendation of neighbors. Our dog had a cut on one of her paws. At any rate, we were thoroughly impressed by the quality of care and compassion of everyone we met. Highly recommend.

name: Harleigh Houston
text: I honestly couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Y’all were beyond amazing!!

name: Sandi Ayers
text: All the doctors are very competent, knowledgeable and caring.  They are willing to do all they can to help with anything your "family" member needs and they don't forget you either.

name: Jean Goodson
text: The veterinarians at NAAH are simply the absolute best in the area and from my experience in the state.  They are kind and caring to pets and parents and never fail to go the extra mile for our beloved fur babies.  The entire staff from the front desk to the back kennels are unfailingly nice and professional.  These folks are the real deal!

name: Forrest Davis
text: The staff here are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. They will answer any questions you have about treatments or the health of your pet. You can tell they truly care about keeping your animals healthy and happy.

name: Teresa Box
text: I was so impressed with NAAH! My Crocker Spaniel has finally got relief from a chronic skin condition. We saw the vet Jason Bonner. He was so thorough. text: Your staff and Veterinarians have always had my fur babies health a priority. Everyone is always very kind and professional but yet you make patients feel like family. Odie really is a great dog.
He had a set back this past Friday night with a hurt right knee. (I’m thinking slept on it wrong).
Dr Troy gave a great assessment and treatment.  He finally is not having to give to it (on Tuesday).
Odie is protecting himself better now. Being very careful.
Thank you Thank You Thankful for ALL of you ⚽️🥏 no more playing chase the squirrels 🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿🐿
(Too expensive a game)

text: Everyone went above and beyond with our dog Chloe and we were very happy! Dr. Thompson called me off and on during the visit to discuss treatment and recommendations for Chloe and explained everything in a way we could understand. We will continue to use them for Chloe and for our other pets as well!

text: They make everything so convenient from making appointments to refilling meds. I brought my fur baby there when my old vet was insisting apoquel was a fix all for my dogs allergies even after I told her it had stopped working. text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with animal care specialists!

name: James Lamar
text:
Had Christmas plans to come to Muscle Shoals to visit my dad and then on to Monroe, LA to visit my son. I sent a message to North Alabama Animal Hospital inquiring about boarding. Dr. Thompson called me and answered all of my questions and even invited me to come to the office for a tour when I got in town.  I took my Cavalier King Charles, Sam, with me for the tour and everyone was so nice. I had no concerns after the visit on what kind of care my Sam would be given. The next day I took Sam in and he stayed 3 nights. When I picked him up there were no issues at all. The staff is great and the rates are very reasonable. I’ll definitely board him there again in the future.

James

text: I'm not a local and came into the area for family reasons. I needed a vet to go to and my brother told me to go here. It's the best around he said. Everybody was very friendly... From the staff to the techs and docs.. Even other customers! Great atmosphere. My dog is special to me as she is my medical service dog and I require different methods of care with vets that not a lot will provide. Not here... They were awesome and did everything I asked for and then some. Above and beyond! If I lived in the area, this place would be my only place. If they were where I'm from I would switch in a heartbeat.. Of you love your fury friends then you should be taking them here for care.

text: We have used NAAH for seven years now, and recommended them without reservation. My dogs have experienced some health issues here and there, some serious, others not, and not a single time has a diagnosis been incorrect or a treatment ineffective (which I realize can happen even under stellar care, but its worth noting). They do not run pricey tests without your go-ahead, but lay it all on the table for you to choose. Also, we drive 70 miles round trip and it is worth it. So, trust your pets to the care there and you will not be disappointed.

text: Dr. Youngblood did surgery on our Lucy's knee.  We couldn't be more satisfied and happy with her progress. Her follow-up and physical therapy with Dr. Brumby is going extremely well. After each visit, she is able to use her injured leg a little more.  We definitely recommend Dr. Youngblood and his entire staff.

Sadly animal care at 'All Creatures Pet Hospital', is not a priority. Today it was clear, $money$ is their priority. My son's Service Dog, needed antibiotics. Dr. Hankes stated he will give my sons dog the antibiotics he needs as he came outside to explain why. Then the itemized bill came out and I was going to be charged almost $50, for the meds!!. This was not a 'gift' as Dr. Hankes stated. The lady stated the Doctor has a bad habit of saying those things. I did not get the antibiotics due to an incredibly, and highly inflated prices. I found the same prescription from GoodRx, for less then $20 that Publix could fill. name: Jules
text: I rushed my dog here after he broke his leg at the Black Creek Dog Park on a Saturday. After they did the X-ray, they told me he would need surgery and they would have to refer him out. I wanted to take him right away, but they assured me no one would be open until Monday. They lied to my face. The office they referred me to (and who they said they work with all the time) is open 24/7. They kept him the entire weekend without giving me any updates, delayed his surgery, and charged me $900 for the unnecessary boarding. My advice is to drive the extra distance and find a reliable vet in Birmingham who won't swindle you.

resp.text:
Wow! We can't believe this review. This review is completely unfair and not honest. Her dog was seen here four months ago. We don't know why she is suddenly writing a review. First, we don't keep pets here just to make money. We did not charge her $900 for boarding. That's just not true. Hospitalization (boarding) was charged for her pet to stay here for two nights at the cost of $108.22, which included administering the pain medication and antibiotics through the weekend. We stayed late to examine, sedate (to eliviate her dogs pain while she was positioned for radiographs), administered intravenous fluids, splinted her leg, and administer pain and antibiotic medications to her dog through the weekend. All treatments that we provided were completed at her request and signature. The charges weren't any different than would have been charged at any other clinic in Birmingham. This client was not our client and she couldn't get in at any other vet in the area late on a Saturday morning just before we closed at noon.

Finally, we could not discharge her pet because he was completely asleep (sedated). It's something that vets just don't do. Bad things can happen when patients aren't kept quiet and still to rest and stabilize while under anesthesia. Also, the liability of someone driving in a hurry down the highway, slamming on their breaks and causing their dog to fly through the air and breaking it's neck is not a smart thing to allow.

Also, our honest experience had been that the surgical center doesn't see patients for routine fractures on the weekend. They are kept hospitalized at a general hospital or at the ER until Monday. The emergency hospital that is associated with the surgical center IS open 24/7 for emergencies throughout the weekend. That is probably the information that the client is referring to. This wasn't an emergency as he wasn't in shock and we had stabilized him on intravenous fluids. We literally called down there today and the technician told us that a bill for observation through the weekend for a dog with a simple fracture on intravenous fluids, antibiotics and pain medications at the emergency hospital would literally approach $2000.

So, we saved this client over $1000, saw her dog when nobody else would, stayed late and provided high quality medicine, and did what was best for her dog.

This review is not honest or accurate and should be removed.

name: Donna Elliott

He referred surgery to fix the problem but with the financial struggle that covid has caused everyone we just couldn’t do it. We decided to move further with a management plan instead of surgery. He also made it very clear that if in the future we wanted to go ahead with the surgery he himself would do it. I couldn’t ask for a more understanding Vet or more helpful staff. My daisy has been doing much better since we got her on her new medication and is not in anymore pain. We have also started a savings account so we can get the surgery done asap! text: I recently moved to Gardendale and chose this office because it's close to where I live and it was well-reviewed.  I have 4 pets- one I just adopted, and I took her in to establish care. The first time we went, the lady who examined my dog came out to speak to me, gave me a thorough explanation of the exam, tips on treating her skin issues, food, etc. I was told she had an ear infection and we needed to come back 2 weeks later for a re-evaluation.  She told me to come back on a Saturday so I could see the same vet again.  We did just that.  However, this time my dog was examined by Dr. Hankes.  Our appointment was at 10:30am, but we weren't greeted until 10:55.  Dr. Hankes called me instead of coming to speak to me directly (which is fine, it was raining).  He told me that the heartworm medication I was using was ineffective and I needed to do some research on it online.  I've used it for years per a veterinarian in the family's recommendation.  I still can't find poor reviews about the medication online, for the record.  He also said that he preferred to not use 1800PetMeds because it was too much trouble for him to fax in prescriptions.  I asked him to examine my dog for another concerning issue I had, he said he would, but no call from him or response.  A few minutes later, a girl came out with a credit card machine (no invoice) asking me for $70.  I was hoping to start taking all 4 of my pets here for their vet needs, but we will be returning to Avondale Animal Hospital, where the vets take the time to answer all of your questions and don't upsell medications.  The receptionists are extremely kind and friendly, but the mask ordinance is not valued whatsoever.

name: Kb Bolds
text: I called to find out how much it would cost to get my dog spayed and they quoted me a price of $129 saying it included the spaying, boarding for one night, and the IV catheter. They get her vet records from my vet and told me she needed a bordatella vaccine, ok fine. I drop my dog off and they call me later to say she’s doing great. The next morning, they call and say she’s vomiting and want to give her an injection for the vomiting and I agree after them saying it’ll be $49 for it. I go to pick up my dog and the total is $415!!! I was charged $179 for the spaying, an additional fee for the IV catheter, and a stool sample that I didn’t even consent to.  I only brought her there instead of my normal vet because mine is an hour away and I have an infant but lesson learned! I will NEVER use this place again.

resp.text:
Hi Ms. Bolds,
We are extremely saddened to hear that you felt as though your experience with us was not pleasant. We strive to give our clients and their beloved pets the best experience we can offer. Your sweet baby Mercedes came in on 7/14/20 for a spay, which went perfect. Unfortunately the morning after her surgery, we noticed that she was vomiting a little, which we immediately informed you about. When we spoke with you about the vomiting, our associate suggested treatment, which you approved. The relief veterinarian that was on duty thought a fecal exam (stool sample) would help us to be sure that there were no other issues associated with her vomiting, which may have been miscommunicated (we gladly refunded this nominal fee). With this test we did find that Mercedes had hookworms, which can be associated with vomiting in many pets. We informed you of her results and suggested we deworm her. At that time you declined that service. At pick up the receptionist informed you of all charges before finalizing any payment, which at that time you agreed to with no questions asked or problems. When we spoke on 7/16/20, two days after your sweet baby had her surgical procedure to discuss your overall experience, to our surprise you told us that you were unsatisfied with our services. At that time you stated that when you first called for a price quote you were quoted $129 for the spay and were also told that included an IV catheter. This could not have happened as all of our receptionist have been on staff for quite some time and know that these procedures are not included in the surgery fee. I think what happened (because it happens a lot) is that you truly wanted these important protective measures for Mercedes but it all added up to more than you expected it to be with the treatment for the vomiting and nausea. Also, on the sheet that you filled out with the list of recommended pre-surgical procedures such as blood work and IV catheter, the price is clearly stated next to it. Plus there is a box to check yes or no as to whether you wanted the procedure or not right next to the price. Why would we ask you to chose yes or no if it was already included? We refunded you over $107 (which we didn't have to do) as a gesture of good will and you still remained upset and gave us a negative review. Bottom line is that you chose the added procedures which were performed.

name: Rebecca “Yo Momma” Saxon
text: We've only being using this veterinarian office for a few months. We got a NEW PUPPY, Miss Lola, but we've finished our puppy shots and will be getting neutered soon. We have had nothing but great experiences here. ... professional and loving staff and Veterinarian. .
