name: Jake McAllister
text:
Up sales!! BEWARE!!!

So to start this off please understand, I am not a medical professional, however I professionally remove and rehabilitate wildlife. I am very experienced in just about all wounds, injury's, illnesses, and human harm caused by domestic and non-domestic animals.

I have recently adopted a Dutch Shepherd, my primary vet for all of my inquires is Mercy Hospital(whom in my experience I would trust with my own life!)

My dog was a rescue, obviously covered in parasites from previous settings.

I explained the situation to the profession under review( my wife made this appointment due to the ease involving COVID-19, as mercy was booked)

Keep in  mind as a wildlife professional, I have already assessed my dogs illness.

The main reason for a vet was to acquire a  accurate heart worm test.
When handing over my beloved Dutch shepherd I caught myself telling the vets office about her harmless  Sinus Arrhythmia Heart Rhythm(very common in dogs while sleeping)

Longer story shorter, the vet personally talked to me telling me that my dog has a serious heart murmur, and attempted to sway me into the tests to verify. I already knew with no doubt there is not a heart murmur.

The doctor himself turned into a upselling salesmen attempting to use sympathy to sway me into purchasing tests. I am also a licensed insurance producer for Alabama so I am very aware of salesmen tactics, and I will say he tried. He tried very hard in his sympathetic approach claiming I need to do it now, its very serious.

I then proceeded to my normal vet at Mercy Hospital for a second opinion. My Vet listened to my dogs heart for an extended period, as well as got another in house vet to listen as well as me, we all concluded there is no murmur and the heart is in great condition, afterword's ran tests to conclude.

This goes to show, don't try to scam people on sympathy, you never know how educated the other party is in your field.

Also as a consumer warning always be weary of ratings when choosing a service, especially when life is involved, a huge amount of services either pay for reviews, or pay there employees a commission per 5 star review.

I wouldn't use a dishonest practice such as this, but I also can not say my mentioned vet is your best choice, I only speak from personal experience.

resp.text:
We unequivocally and absolutely DO NOT upsell unneeded diagnostics at this hospital! We offer and provide medically what is appropriate for each pet. We are sorry that Mr. McAllister did not have the experience at our clinic that he wanted. Due to the accusative and completely unfair nature of his review, we must clear up numerus false assertions that he has made. We have reviewed the chart from his dog's visit with the doctors and staff involved. After discussing, all involved remembered clearly the visit. To say that we use sympathy to perform inappropriate diagnostics is completely inaccurate and unfair.

First, he requested (just like any other clinic, our receptionists write down EXACTLY on the chart what the client requests for us to do) to have his dog examined because lately she had been mopey. That was his exact words. The primary request was not to have a heartworm test performed. That was a secondary request.

Secondly, his dog had a heart murmur and wasn't feeling well. That is something very different than a sinus arrhythmia which is completely benign. The further cardiac diagnostics that we offered to fully assess the heart condition in a rescue dog was completely indicated (remember this is a rescue in which the medical history is unknown) and was the best medical practice for this dog. Sometimes diagnostics that are performed come back normal and that is great but it doesn't mean that the diagnostics weren't indicated. All vet hospitals offer tests that commonly come back normal.

Both of our doctors have been out of vet school 24 and 47 years respectively and are very capable of diagnosing heart problems. They do not offer diagnostics that are not indicated but they do offer the best medical diagnostics and treatments for all pets. Do some pet owners decline to have offered diagnostics performed. Yes, every hospital experience this on a daily basis. Do some murmurs come and go? Yes. Did this happen in this case? Maybe.

Also, why did the other clinic go ahead and do the further diagnostics if it wasn't indicated?? The answer is that they were indicated! Unbelievable! The diagnostics that we offered were indicated.

So we were presented with a large breed dog that was approximately 5 years old (which makes it middle aged) and had been RESCUED. Dogs that have been rescued commonly have heartworms because they haven't receive proper care which includes heartworm prevention. If it had heartworms they very well could have and commonly can cause a heart murmur.

Bottom line: for someone untrained in the veterinary field that rescues and rehabilitates animals to accuse us of using sympathy and scamming people to increase diagnostics is deplorable. The other clinics in the area know we don't do this just as we know they don't practice this way either. This clinic has been here for over 45 years and the current owner has owned it for the past 15 years. We have a great reputation and thousands of happy clients.

This review is a good example of LIBEL and is illegal. It should be removed!

name: Willie Webster
text: Exceptional  service. Best vet in town. i drive 45 minutes just to use them for my Hercules. Received  above and beyond service from Jeni Jami and Lara. You guys rock!!!!!!! Recommend to anyone.

name: Cynthia McKinney
text: I recently went with my daughter when she took her cat in about a problem it was having. I felt we were treated very rudely by the vet. He made my daughter feel like she was mistreating her cat when I know she takes very good care of her cat. The cat got sick very quickly and he made it seem like her cat had been neglected for a long time. He seem to treat everyone rudely, we could here him get angry over trivial stuff and get mad at the people in the back. It was very unprofessional and my daughter said she is never going back. I had brought my dog in several months ago and saw Dr. Oaken and he was very nice and seemed really kind and helpful, I recommended the clinic to my daughter based on my experience with Dr. oaken, but then she got the other vet and didn't understand the difference. One of the ladies at the front desk was very sweet and nice, she was the one having a baby. I was shocked by the other lady, I found out later she was the manager. My neighbor is the one who told me she was the manager and she had had problems too. When I was there she kept putting people on the phone on hold to continue her personal conversations that had nothing to do with the business. She also gossiped the entire time I was there and even gossiped about a customer who just left!!1! That is awful and I couldn't believe someone like that would be manager. My daughter was in tears when she left, she paid over $200 to be made to feel like an awful pet parent. We will never come back and will tell other people too.

name: Lanette Parker
text: The new management isn’t very personal or friendly.  This Lady who called herself the “manager” wouldn’t sell me the medication I needed for my dog. It was all very unfortunate and unprofessional. I’ve been going there for 5 years.  I can’t believe the Doctor hired someone so mean to be around animals. She was like a terrifying virus, don’t let your fur babies around her.

resp.text: Ms. Parker:  I am glad you took the time to express your concerns about the care you received in our clinic on Saturday, February 22, 2020.  I was sorry to hear you were already having a difficult day and we have all had bad days.  I empathize with you and I hope you are doing better.  Per our conversations, your cat Lily has not been seen by a doctor since May of 2018 and it is illegal to dispense prescription medications to animals not under routine veterinary care.  This is entirely to protect, your baby, Lily.  We are still here to provide for you non-prescription items for Lily and since Ava has been seen within a year, and has a negative heartworm test, we are happy to assist with any prescription needs you may have.  I am terribly disappointed my attempts to help you within the confines of our laws and affections towards the overwhelmingly important pets we are honored to care for was interpreted as you feel.  I am here if you would like to stop by the clinic at any time and work towards understanding each other and caring for Lily and Ava.  Kind regards, Catherine West, All Creatures Pet Hospital Practice Manager

name: Roger Paul
text: Recently we began taking our three dogs to All Creatures Pet Hospital; we transitioned from another practice.  Dr. Hankes and his crew (Desiree, Allie, Catherine, Jackie, Ashley and Ellen) have been a true gift.  Sadly, one of our dogs became heartworm positive despite being on a heartworm medication. Dr. Hankes was abreast of the literature and knew that the med we were using has a failure rate against resistant strains that came to this area following Hurricane Katrina.  Dr. Hankes and his staff handled the transition of our three dogs with dignity, efficiency and professionalism.  On a busy Saturday he worked us in and again the following Monday for “round two” of treatment. We were allowed to be with our dog during treatment and every step in the treatment was explained.  We now have our dogs on a medication known to be effective against heartworm, including resistant strains.  When Nick had a complication following treatment, Dr. Hankes and crew worked him in yet again and got him back to feeling better.  It is a blessing to be in the care of a knowledgeable, kind and compassionate provider.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words about our clinic!

name: J Lo
text: Dr. Hankes and his staff are fantastic! I live in TN and was in town visiting friends and family, and needed a vet to check out my fur baby. He was able to work my puppy in last minute before the holidays for a minor surgery. He took excellent care of him and throughly answered all of my questions. He was so kind and professional. It’s so nice to have met a vet that I can trust...and that my little guy trusts, too. I wish I could find a vet like Dr. Hankes here in TN.

name: Leola Gibson
text: Dr. Hankins is very approachable and kind. He explained to me in detail all issues involving my pet.  The staff is exceptionally accommodating, especially (mommy to be). I call her that because I can't recall her name.

name: courtney galvan
text: My husband and I travel a lot for his job and a couple months ago my gsp was put on medication for seizures. Unfortunately it is a controlled substance and he needs to be seen by a vet for refills. I called All creatures vet and they were able to get us in the next day. All staff was incredibly friendly and was able to work with us in finding a non controlling medication. Prices were very reasonable as well! Highly recommend this vet!!

name: Keith Tolbert
text: They saw our little 12 year old Shitzu with a severe bacterial and ear infection when they were about to close for the day.  We were so thankful because they could have turned her away since it was actually after closing time.  Thank you for staying open to see our little angel.  She was in agony, but with your treatment, she is on the road to recovery!  Thank you so much!!!

name: Lauren Herndon
text: My husband and I took our puppy to all creatures for his 3rd round of shots and 3rd puppy visit. After having a very bad experience at Stewart animal clinic, this place did such an AWESOME job. They took great care of my sweet buddy, even when he got super excited. The vet checked his teeth, listened to his heart, looked over his previous records and asked us questions about his health the previous shots he had gotten. I was so pleased and happy when we left. The techs and front desk staff are also so great. Kelli checked me in and let me know beforehand that they had two emergencies come in and there could be a wait, I was okay with that and filled out paperwork. The two techs that worked with buddy did such an awesome job of helping keep him calm and holding him so Dr. Hankes could look at him. All in all, I’m so pleased with all creatures. You have patients for life!

name: Christina Presnell
text: Dr. Hankes and all of his staff are awesome!  They took such good care of our furbaby!  I could not be more pleased with the care and service she/ we received!  I highly recommend All Creatures Pet Hospital! They are the best!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

name: Tammy Hauerwas
text: The only place I use for all of my animal's.  I love everybody that works there.

name: Robert K Miller
text: I have been using All Creatures for several years. Dr. Ted and his staff are the best!  Dr. Ted will be gentle and thorough in the treatment and care for your fur baby. When my grand dog was fixed, he was well taken care of during his visit and overnight stay. Dr. Ted will instruct you on post op wound care, meds and rehab. I always recommend All Creatures, whether you live in Birmingham or farther out like Tuscaloosa it is worth the drive for the care and service you get.

name: Jacob Sides
text: I’ve been taking my pup to there daycare program for a while now. She seems to enjoy it and the prices are much better then the others that offer daycare services in the Gardendale area. The staff will go above and beyond to make sure you and your animals are happy.

name: Joseph Hankes
text:
The staff here are consistently friendly and professional and genuinely care about your animal.
The quality of care and services far outweigh the reasonable pricing they offer.
The hospital has been recently updated and has a warm and comfortable atmosphere for both human and pets alike.

name: Kelli Hollon
text: Absolutely the best. I had a terrible experience at a different clinic in gardendale. But this place exceeded all of expectations and took great care of my kitty and myself! Recommend this place!

name: Vincent Hocutt
text:
All Creatures is staffed with compassionate people that treat your pet like their own.
After a misunderstanding in some treatment cost that had been duplicated from a visit at another vet.... even though it was found out the error was due to previous vets inadequate records, Dr Hayes offered to refund the charges.
The crew there takes great care of our FurBaby.  Highly Recommended.

name: Angela Morgan
text: These people are life savers! I was in a serious bind when the vet office in Bessemer that I had made reservations with to board my babies failed to inform me of the fact they would be closing early that day! I called All Creatures right before they closed on New Year's Eve, and these wonderful ladies were so understanding they stayed for 30 minutes until I got there, and was able to go to my aunt's funeral the next day because of them! Thank you so very much!

name: Nancy hughes
text: This is a great place. They know me by name and my pets.  Always friendly and very helpful. Will answer my questions anytime. Dr Hankes is a great vet and his assistants are wonderful.  I feel complete trust in them with my dogs. Thanks to all of you for making our visits great!

name: cheyenne m
text: I'm a broke college student living in Tuscaloosa and I always take my dog to All Creatures Pet Hospital. Dr. Hankes and his staff have always been kind and caring, and you can tell that everyone is passionate about the well being of your pets. Even as a college student, the care is affordable and the 45 minute drive is so worth it! I have never been happier with pet care and I know that my fur baby is always well taken care of when we come here. I recommend this place to all of my friends with pets because they are amazing here. I'd give more stars if I could, 10/10!

name: Destiny Fitch
text: The lady I spoke with on the phone was very nice! And made me feel safe about taking my dog there. We have an appointment this Thursday for my little ginger and we can't wait!!

name: April Clark
text: I can not even describe how wonderful they are here!!! A week ago we thought we were going to have to put our beloved fur baby to sleep. Our baby has IVDD and another  local vet put the wrong medication in our baby’s pill bottle and it caused him to almost seem paralyzed and caused liver damage. Doc and Denise got our baby on the proper medications and with only 4 laser therapy treatments our baby is back to normal!!! Our dog is happy, walking and no longer crying in pain!!! Our family is beyond grateful to everyone here!!

name: Damaris Leon
text:
DO NOT CROP YOUR DOGS EARS HERE!!!!!
It has been 3 months and everything possible has been done to get my dog's ears to stay up. That includes the vet constantly having the ears taped and me doing the same at hone. When they told me they start doing the ears at 13 weeks and no earlier, I was a little sceptical because every other vet said not to do it after 11 weeks but since this was my vet for a while I trusted them. But now Im left with droopy ears and I paid $450 for it.
This is just a little heads up for anyone thinking about getting their dogs ears done here. Also the receptionist (Jenny) should not be allowed to work or much less talk to the clients, she has a horrible attitude and she's very rude and nasty.
They do not call you and let you know about stuff that happens, you just find out on your own when you get there. Apparently they don't watch the animals because I've had numerous issues with my other pets where they had to have surgery for injuries that occurred at daycare. They have lost me as a client and I'm telling everyone else too!

name: Ingrid Ridgeway
text: First let me start of by saying I’m beyond thankful for Dr. Hanke and his staff at ACPH. About a week ago, we brought our puppy in because we honestly believed he had Parvo and was dying. To make a long story short, Dr. Hanke went to do a routine check and just so happened to touch our babies’ tail and we discovered it was insanely infected (he also had a serious skin infection). We scheduled him for surgery the following Monday and I must say, EVERYONE at All Creatures treated us like we were family to them! We couldn’t afford the unexpected expense of his treatment at the moment so they were willing to work with us on paying the bill. They even provide pet insurance!!—Which we are purchasing.  I can NOT thank these people enough for literally saving my fur baby, Luca. Highly recommended!!

name: Tammy Hayes
text: My dogs, Luci and Savannah both love doggie day care.  I have used this vet for years and love them.  Service is great and prices too

name: Scott Plagmann
text: This place has a great vet and the staff is top notch.

name: Brooke Tate
text: Dr Hankes always takes the best care of my pets. Denise is always extremely helpful and knowledgeable and is always willing  and able to answer any questions that I may have about their care. I won't take them anywhere else!

name: Penny Harrison
text:
There is not enough wonderful things I could say about everyone at All Creatures Pet Clinic.
I feel so comfortable boarding our fur babies while we are out of state I am able to enjoy myself knowing that they are in such great hands (They enjoy it as well).
(All 3 of our babies and even a guinea pig receive all of their care here)

Our German Shepard had an "lump" on his belly and Dr Hankes was able to diagnose a tumor and went up and beyond to send it for even further testing now our Snow is healthy and happy thanks to his dedication.
The compassion from the staff after I recently lost one of my fur babies was greatly appreciated .

If you have never visited the clinic I would highly recommend you do so, You would not be disappointed with their services.

name: Sharon Borrell
text: . Dr. Hankes an his staff are wonderful. I have been using All Creatures for many years now and they have always been there when ever I have needed them. My baby (Gunter) has been going to Day Care since he was 10 weeks old. He goes two days a week and he LOVES it. He get so excited when he see me pull up in front of the building he can't wait to get out of the car. I have never seen a dog so happy  in a vets office  before. I would highly recommended for you to check out All Creatures Pet Hospital. There the BEST!!

name: Meredith Walker-Sims
text: All Creatures has always treated our dog (a toy poodle named Baskie) with great care. Denise, Dr. Hankes? and the rest of the staff always do a wonderful job taking care of our baby.

name: Laura Wall
text: This place is AWESOME! I take my hyper puppy everyday to their affordable doggy daycare. He is worn out everytime. The staff is very friendly and is always willing to answer any questions you may have!

name: Adam Roderick
text: Took my cat in at 7:30am for some serious coughing fits that often led to vomiting. Waited until 11:30am to call and check in. When I called, they said she had been seen but that the Vet was busy and would call me back to discuss. I waited until 2:00pm before getting fed up enough to show up in person. When I showed up in person, they said she had not yet been seen (6 1/2 hours later). They said I could wait but that it would still be a while before she could be seen. The whole time I was there, I could hear loud dogs barking and making noise in the back. Lulu (our cat) is a very small cat (a runt I found when she was 4 weeks old after her mom abandoned her). Thinking about her being left in a cage for 6 1/2 hours with big loud dogs barking gets me livid. I have never written a review online before but this was enough for me to start. DO NOT take your pets here. Especially if you have cats. They are extremely careless and are very inconsiderate of mixing pets. The whole time I was checking in, a huge retriever kept sticking his face into the carrier I had Lulu in. The front desk saw that, saw me pushing him away, saw the owner doing nothing about it, and didn't say a word. Truthfully, everyone there seemed nice enough but they are incredibly sloppy and careless. And when you take charge of the care of one of my family members (yes, Lulu is a family member) sloppy isn't good enough. She deserves better.

name: TeResa Worland
text: Vet is more interested in renovations than caring for animals. He neglected my animal to the point of almost death, within 2 days the new vet and surgeon had my cat at a 50 % percent change of living. When I asked for the records someone wrote on the last pave animal was fine at last list, yet within 2 days Mr animal had a 7 inch mass in his intestines. SO lying was also a great part of his heartless treatment. And for him to write the cat was fine. Was telling me he knew be was negligence in supposedly caring for my animal. Please don't take your sick fur baby to him, he is notorious for giving steroid shots which damage animals kidneys. Love your animal enough to avoid this place,

resp.text: We are sorry that Ms. Worland felt this way about our doctor. But we know this is not the truth. Our doctor is very caring and loves pets a great deal. We have remodeled and we do apologize for any inconvenience. But that didn't change the way we cared for her pet during that time frame, which was FOUR MONTHS PRIOR TO THIS REVIEW. We offered all the diagnostics that were needed to diagnosis the cats condition but Ms. Worland declined the tests that we wanted to perform. It is difficult to diagnose a condition without the proper diagnostics being performed. From the results of the examination Ms. Worland's cat appeared stable to go home. Also, an animal's condition can change dramatically and we are always here for clients to call us if a pet's condition changes. Finally, we seldom give steroid injections and only when they are warranted.

name: Tammy Boyington
text: Thank yall for taking care of my turtle Odais 🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢

resp.text: Thank you very much for the nice comment! We are glad to help anytime!

name: Shane Sanders
text: They should change their name because they don't treat all creatures like their name says. Will never call them for anything again.

name: Tammy Boyington
text: Thank yall for taking care of my turtle Odais 🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢🐢

resp.text: Thank you very much for the nice comment! We are glad to help anytime!

name: ZombieJonathon
text: The entire staff is extremely caring and thorough.

name: Doreen Williams
text: I carried my dog in on 7/29/14. She finally is walking better. BUT NOW ANOTHER PROBLEM my dog was trained to her potty pads. So there is my problem , what did they do to my dog. I have got to start all over again . It is much harder with a grown-up dog. The dr said it would be easier. NO!!  For what I paid them for two days they need to re-train her. I am going to talk to someone concerning this matter . MY DOG WILL NOT GO BACK THERE .

name: Shane Sanders
text: They should change their name because they don't treat all creatures like their name says. Will never call them for anything again.

name: Dakota Goodwin
text: all 3 of my pets go here and I couldn’t be more satisfied.very clean and always friendly

name: Mindy Tobin
text: So I have taken My dog here a few times. The first few visits were pretty routine. They are nice ,clean and respectful.My dog had some swollen lymphoids and he  needed blood tests and such. I couldn’t afford them right off. They went ahead and did the test and let me pay it in payments.That was really going beyond the norm when it comes to a vet. So the test came back As cancer. I am so devastated. I was so upset in the office that I had to walk out side and get my self together. When I was out there I locked my keys in the car! Grrrrr... My phone wallet and insurance information were all inside of the car as well! Dr. Fuqua called a lock smith and paid for thier services! I couldn’t believe it! He is a good doctor and an even better man! Thank u Dr. Fuqua!You are awesome!

name: Ben Baugh
text: I have been using All Creatures for the last 10 years. I have 3 Dachshunds and Dr. Hankes and his staff treat them with great care.  I live 30 minutes away and its worth the drive to get great care for my 4 legged kids.  The staff treats our dogs like family. The services they provide are priced fair and reasonable.  In fact, Dr.Hankes  has made himself available on weekends to make sure our pets are taken care off when we have emergency's from time to time.There have been instances that we have needed his expertise on a weekend and Dr. Hankes has helped us out then as well. If you need a Vet that knows what hes doing, I suggest going to All Creatures and tell them Ben sent you.

name: Kelly Daniel
text: We love visiting Dr. Hankes and his staff at All Creatures Pet Hospital! They always love on our two fur babies when we visit their office. Dr. Hankes was especially patient with our many questions when we added our most recent rescue puppy to the family. We wouldn't recommend anyone else to take care of our babies!

name: Charles McKinney
text: Fantastic staff who will remember your name and your pets. Very personable.

name: Erica LaRoman
text: Love the workers and how they treated my baby Minnie! I recommend them to any one they are nice to talk to.

name: Erica LaRoman
text: Love the workers and how they treated my baby Minnie! I recommend them to any one they are nice to talk to.

name: Jennifer Levesque
text:
We have taken our fur babies to Dr Hankes for several years now. He kept my yorkie Rudy, who had congestive heart failure, alive and happy for many more years than I thought was possible. Once Rudy did pass away Dr Hankes was very kind and understanding of our pain he even sent me flowers. My other fur baby Fi-Fi a Chihuahua mix that had been abandoned in a box on the vets door step. Knowing I was looking for a puppy he gave us a call.
When we got our next puppy Pete a few months ago from Tuscaloosa Metro Animal shelter we had dr Ted check him out and even though we had a free neuter do to us at the shelter we prefered to have Dr Hankes perform the operation because Ted uses more safety procedures and gives the animal pain meds to take at home where many vets skip things like IVs and pain control. Ted puts the animals safty and pain control as a high priority.
Dr Hankes has so much experience with animals from trauma (U.S. Army vet) to being a cat lover himself. He truly is an awsome vet.

name: Candy Rue
text: I felt very comfortable with the staff here,  I felt 100 perfect sure in placing my bull dog in all creatures hands.

name: Marie Haulsey
text: The folks at All Creatures took wonderful care of our four animals during the three years we lived in Gardendale.  Everyone was friendly, and took the time to get to know not just our animals' physical concerns, but also their personalities.  Our dogs miss their human and animal friends at day care.  In one case of emergency, Dr. Hankes and Denise stayed over an hour extra to take care of one of our animals, and in another, Dr. Hankes made a special trip back to the clinic for us.

name: Ken Levesque
text:
2-15-17:  my two dogs went to All Creatures two days ago with explosive diarreah and vomiting.  It was a horrendous weekend.  We tried Pepto Bismal and other things.  Monday morning I took my little dogs down there and was greeted warmly by the staff.  They showed genuine concern asked lots of questions.  The feeling I had was like they were family.  Then the doctor just didn't alleviate the sickness but it was almost "creepy" how he COMMANDED the situation.  My pets came home the same day and the vomiting and diarreah FULLY ERADICATED.  Animal medicine is converted into TALENTED HEALING at All Creatures Pet Hospital.  I can't another option around here.

I've taken my 2 dogs to Dr. Ted many times in the last year or so and have had nothing but a great experience.  I think he's a terrific and caring doctor and extremely knowledgeable.  All of his staff are friendly and always on the move.  They don't like it when people have to wait and they seem to work really hard to get to everyone.  I also have had my 2 pets in the kennel there and I was invited to go back and see them anytime I wanted.  I did go back to the kennels and the "condos" and they are extremely clean and beautiful.  Dr. Ted is an Afghanistan Army Veteran so I'm really glad that my vet is a real vet!  He saved my little dog from a heart problem that otherwise would have killed him.  I went to Dr. Ted when the treatments he was getting in another Vet Clinic in Gardendale weren't having any affect.  I've been please ever since.  I won't go anywhere else.  I've never thought I over paid either.

name: Billy Hughes
text: Kind and caring staff and doctor!!

name: Janet Sanders
text: On Oct 31st 2014 my 4 pound toy poodle Gabbi was dropped by my elderly father. She fell four feet on her head to a concrete floor. She was unconscious and not breathing. I rushed her to her Veterinarian Dr. Ted Hankes at All Creatures. Dr. Hankes and his staff did everything right to save her life. At the time we did not know that she had two scull fractures and a fractured vertebra. Thankfully Dr. Hankes prepared for the worst. The care he gave her kept her brain from swelling and kept her alive. After getting Gabbi stable he sent me to an emergency hospital where he continued to call and check on her the entire weekend. I am very happy to say that because of his excellent care along with many other excellent doctors my precious girl is completely well. Other than the fact she is extremely spoiled and overweight. If you could see Gabbi today you would never know the head trauma she suffered. She had a checkup today and is doing very well. I can't put into words the gratitude I feel for the entire staff at All Creatures. Thank you to everyone that had a hand in saving my baby girl. Also thanks for the care you give her older sister CoCo.  My husband and I will be eternally grateful.

name: Jan Berry
text:
Dr. Hankes, Denise, and the gang at All Creatures are tops when it comes to taking care of my baby girl, Sasha!  BYW, please don't tell Sasha she's a c-a-t.  Sasha was adopted from All Creatures 12 yrs ago as a 6 wk old when Dr. Allen held the reins and my son was a lab tech.

With the arrival of Dr. Hankes (and my son was gone to college), as you can imagine there were questions about the changes coming.  I have been so very pleased with the continuation of great services and getting to know another vet who is not only a well trained physician but truly loves all the pets that come in and wants the very best for them and their guardians.  The big bonus is that Denise (Sr. Lab Tech), who Sasha usually sees - and Sasha's very shy, has won over my baby and even has her choosing to stay with Ms. Denise instead of me after injections and exams some days.  That says A LOT for the caring ways of the team at All Creatures and who they are as crew members/care givers not just employees..

Recently, Sasha had a period of rapid weight loss after getting a kidney issue under control and Dr. Hankes found that she had a growth on her thyroid as well as fluid around her heart causing breathing issues.  She was a very sick little girl.  Dr. Hankes treated her heart and brought it under control and within a period of weeks.  Dr. Hankes, teamed with Dr. Hall, was then able to remove the problematic portion of the thyroid and the growth.  Now 4 wks after surgery, her heart is doing well - she's gaining weight and running round the house like a wild 4 yr old instead of a 12 yr old.  Dr. Hankes and Dr. Hall did a great job with the surgery, the staff let Sasha recouperate in her basket with a blanket from home and are now keeping a tabs on her for a while to make sure her remaining thyroid is functioning properly.  Thanks to their great care, we're looking forward to many more years together.

I have recommended All Creatures to my family, friends and new neighbors who are in need of a vet and have for years and hope you'll see them, too.  I don't know of any Pet Hospital around where you can get the top quality care PLUS the Super Care Givers that are on the team with Dr. Hankes at All Creatures Pet Hospital.  You'll be glad you've found one of the gems of not only Gardendale but the Greater Birmingham/Jefferson Area.

name: Kaitlyn Koehler
text: Everything and everyone was amazing!

name: Sueann Repp
text: We have been very pleased with the care that has been given to our pets.  Thank you!

name: ralph thomas
text: GREAT VETS, GREAT AND CARING EMPLYEES

name: denise Nance
text: The staff are very friendly .

name: Cheyenne Martin
text: Moulton Vet Hospital always has me covered when it comes to any of my pets or livestock. They are very responsive, and they take the very best care of all animals. I have always had great customer service! I know that when I take an animal to them they are in the best hands!

name: Geana Mitchell
text: They take good care of of our dog when we board her there.

name: Branch Beech
text: Tried twice to schedule an appointment. Each time they said they would call us back but never did. If you're looking for a responsive vet, don't waste your time here.

name: julie mclemore
text: Dr. Lee and his staff at Moulton Veterinary Hospital go above and beyond in caring for your pets, as well as in customer service. We are grateful to have them caring for our 4 legged family members. If you haven’t been there, try them out! You will see! :)

name: Kathy Graham
text: I love MOULTON veterinary hospital and the care they give the animals and the owners of the animals. They are compassionate and take care of all involved.

name: Rose King
text: He looked at our midget white turkey when no one else would.  He was very helpful.

name: Debbie Rappuhn
text: I am Debbie Rappuhn, President of Heart of Alabama Save Rescue Adopt!  We have started taking all of our pets to this clinic because we have run out of places in our area that care about our rescues enough, and what we do to help us with fees.  I am so very impressed with their kindness and service and they are paying it forward in my view, to help animals in need!  Thank you from our HASRA team for caring for our babies in the most loving way!  We really appreciate you kindness and service!!!!

name: Wendell Chambers
text: Took our dog who had parvor “they said”. She is acting like she’s better. That’s not the issue. When we got her back she had blood all over her and a big whole in her chest with infection coming out of it. Had to ask about it and medicine for it. Also charged us 562$ and never mentioned how much it would be until we get there to pick her up and said we couldn’t leave with her until we had the full amount

name: Sabrina
text: I was extremely pleased with the quality of service my pets and I received here. We brought in 2 female cats to be fixed on two different days and they scheduled and preformed the surgeries quickly efficiently. Procedure cost a little more then at other places but not extremely pricey either. Also the cats barely had a incision mark or anything else. The cats were well taken care of and back to normal in no time. I am happy to say I will recommend this place to others.

name: Jennifer Garrison
text: Very knowledgeable and takes great care of our pets and livestock.

name: Dawn Hogan
text: What a difference the laser therapy did for Willie’s ear today!!  He was constantly shaking and scratching at his ear and after the laser treatment he was so much better within an hour !!!!!  As always Willie got the best treatment by everyone there !!

name: Jayla Gash
text: Pretty professional. I feel as though they should communicate as staff with each better. I was over charged because I asked for one thing and it wasn’t communicated properly with other staff. But the refunded a portion. Also, if my dog is being boarded, and I call to check on her, you need to actually give me details on her well-being. Don’t just say “she’s fine” and you haven’t actually gotten off your butt to check. Other than my last visit, overall I haven’t had any issues.

name: Wanda Sessions
text: Although I'd prefer to be able to come in and stay with my girl, I know she's in the best hands with Dr. McMillan and his staff!

name: Val OBrien
text: My kitty was very ill this week with an infection. The medical staff at PC Animal Hospital were very caring and persistent on making her well. She is recovering well and I appreciate all of them!

name: Krissy Kinsey
text: My cat had to be spayed quickly because of a constant infection. I was concerned about cost because I'm between jobs and they quoted me $160 by phone. When I picked up my kitty imagine my surprise when she stated my bill was $260.....$100 over what they said...this on top of the $100.28 I already paid for the initial exam and antibiotics ! I am now going to struggle just to pay my utilities this month which are already past due. Other than the outrageous prices, they took good care of my kitty. If money wasn't an issue I would take all my animals there.

name: Lee Yates
text:
I can't say enough good about this place the professionalism they cared as much for me as they did of my little sissy girl .at this trying time. They prepared here for me to take her home to her final resting place .From the bottom of my heart Thank y'all
Rest in peace sissy girl

name: Susan Randle
text: Very dedicated doctors and staff! They pay extra attention to the pets and keep the owners informed. I've used this clinic for 10+ years! Love them!

name: Linda Fontes

I have left my French Bulldogs at many places in St Clair county.
None compare to the quality of care my pups receive here.
They are loved exercised and watered also fed well
The Doctor and staff are the sweet people
Thank you for taking such good care of my babies
Linda Fontes

text: This vet is very good at what they do..  they are always so nice an welcoming of anyone and any furry friend.  We love pell city animal hospital and we always refer people to this vet. They have saved some of my babies and took good care of them. The best understanding an helpful vet we have had.

name: Laura Smitherman
text: I trust you! May sound simple but honestly, my pups are extreme important to me. I truly believe you all do the best you can to make them safe. Thank you all.

name: Holly Mims
text: This was the first time I’ve taken a sick animal to this vet. Dr. Farmer and his staff were wonderful and treated my baby with love and care. Dr. Farmer was very thorough with his instructions for our pup and I am very happy with my decision to use this groups of veterinarians.

name: Sherry Bishop
text: The team at PCAH take great care of my cats!  They are warm and friendly people and take time to talk to me whenever I have a question or concern, no matter how trivial or strange it may be!  I never feel like they think I'm bothering them and they always return my calls when they say they will.  They go above and beyond to care for my cats.  I highly recommend them if you want great quality care for your pets!

name: Paige Allen
text: You walked me through the entire process of everything Fynn had and answered all my questions and put my mind at ease. Fynn came through with flying colors and you took great care of my fur-baby. Such friendly, helpful staff!!!! We are both so pleased.

name: Lee Karcher
text: We boarded our Bella with this facility over a weekend and they took great care of her. All of the staff was super friendly and you could really tell they LOVE their animal friends. I felt sorry for them at our drop off on Saturday because they were so busy and seemed understaffed. I hope others see a need for more staff here and hire some great people because these ladies were going above and beyond to take care of everyone with the crazy COVID restrictions in place. They never slowed down so I cannot imagine them having to keep this pace every weekend. Our hold time to check in was about 20 minutes but we were happy to wait bc we saw the issue was just not enough hands on deck, nothing else. They were very professional, super sweet, and we are so happy that they will be Bella's new vet facility in Pell City. I highly recommend Pell City Animal Hospital to anyone looking for great animal care.

text: So many reasons to get your animals treated here. The front office staff is friendly and helpful. All the Dr’s are exceptional with both my cat and dog. One of my favorites is Dr Bearden sitting in the floor with me and my golden retriever (talking treatment to BOTH of us). My golden loves to carry her doggie in with her for comfort and they let her with out complaining (as they pick it up over and over). We have had nothing but great experiences here!

name: Trina Barrett
text: I don’t do reviews often. Dr. Farmer is a wonderful vet and I have used him for years. However recently we saw Dr. Bearden. I cannot recommend her under any circumstances. My dog had an obvious deformation in her leg after an accident. Dr. Bearden put her in a splint, took X-rays and told us she would send them to a surgeon. Each week we went back and the treatment plan/diagnosis/story changed. The staff would tell me something different than she did each time. She never sent the X-rays to a surgeon. 6 weeks this went on. (Shame on me for letting it go on so long) On the last visit the dog was dropped off 7am, at her request, for observation without the splint. She didn’t look at the dog or remove the splint until I called at 1:30 for an update. At 3:30 she claimed the dog only had “liganitis” but was still not putting weight on the leg. When I asked about the “dent” she claimed I had never told her about it. Not true, and it was easy to see on the dog’s leg. She wanted to give the dog back without a splint. I had the staff splint the leg and took the dog to another vet. She had to have a metal plate surgically implanted to fix the damage. Because of Dr Bearden’s poor diagnostic skills, I cannot recommend PC Animal Hospital unless you see Dr. Farmer.

text: I wanted to say a big thank you from our family ! My husband brought our dog in Bella in this week not knowing what was going on with her . She couldn't drink water by herself but yesterday she got up an went to her water bowl an drank some . Today she jumping around and playing ! She's taken little bites of her food ! I'm guessing that normal after having a upset stomach for 4 days ! But I can't thank staff enough for helping us with her an giving us every piece of information they could !
